transcripts.text: Thank you.  Alright, I am Anders Hagström here today with Tara La Rosa, the MMA fighter who pinned down an anti-Trump protester in Portland last week before Veterans Day.  Tara, the video seems to start sort of in the middle of things.  You know, we're not really sure what happened before and after the video.  It just shows you on top of this woman.  What exactly happened?  Could you walk us through the process of what led to that moment?
Okay, so she kind of came out of nowhere.
It was really bizarre.
And we only had about a half an hour left until we were going to leave.  We only wanted to be out there from 11 till 2.  So it was 1.30 in the afternoon.
And she walked up behind us.

We were spread out down the overpass, kind of like waving flags and cars were honking and stuff.  It was great.  And she came up behind us.  And a few people had come up.  earlier in the day and we're talking about us like, what are we doing?  Why are we there?  All the stuff.  And they were super cool.  Everybody was supportive.  A couple of veterans came by.  It was great.  And so we engaged her as if anybody else welcoming, like, Hey, how are you?  What's up?  And she was not receptive.  Like she, it's almost like she didn't know how to take that because as we found out, she knew why she was there.  And so she took up this stance and planted her feet on the ground, crossed her arms and she goes, F you, F you, F you too.
Uh-huh.
B, called me a B.
Uh-huh.
And yeah, and then I was like, oh no.  So I was like, forget it.
I just turned around and kept waving at the cars and waving flag, whatever.  Yeah.

I ignored her.  And everybody that was right around me seems to follow suit.  I think they did also.  But once I turned around, I was like, I'm done.  And so she must have walked down further on the overpass, and that's when she engaged the people that were down there, who were still part of my group, and I guess that's when the altercation started.
And so you saw that happen, and you walked over there and intervened, or what was going on when you walked over there?

I didn't see it, no.  After I turned around, because I was not getting involved, I didn't want to have a confrontation, I turned around and I lost sight of her.  And then the guys... started calling for me Tara Tara come break this up come break this up I'm like oh man I had just started my live stream at that point because I only wanted to live stream for a half an hour.  so then I caught a little bit of the fight on tape and I stuck it in my pocket because I needed to
handle
her I needed to pull her back and so I grabbed hold of her and she started fighting me and I was like nope
nope I know how to... How quick did she go down, let's ask?
It was less than three seconds.

Okay, less than three seconds, there it is.  It was pretty quick.  Yeah, and you said that she knew the reason she was there, essentially, so she knew what you guys were about, and she was a protester against you guys, or what was that about?

Yeah, so we, okay, we made a very concerted effort to not bring any Trump flags or wear a lot of Trump gear because we want it to be about the veterans.  And we also know that when we bring the Trump flags out and stuff like that, it draws different attention.  I'm not going to say unwanted, but it just, it sends a different message.  And we just wanted it to be about the veterans.  So there was an effort to, to make it, We had a big, awesome banner made that said proud of our veterans that we put over top the overpass that everybody that was driving underneath could read.  And it was fun.
It was great.

But she came over.  Apparently she had two friends that were scouting us out and they were standing sort of catty corner on like an intersection watching us for a good 45 minutes to an hour, hour.  And then she must have arrived and then came over and...
And she was some sort of a professor?
No!  You're going to jail!  I am a professor!  It doesn't matter!  A professor's going to jail!  You're not going to be a professor for very long!  You should fucking know better than me!
Is that correct?  Yeah, she was.  That's what she said.  Yeah.
That's what she said.  She said, I'm a professor.  I'm like, well, you should know better then.

And when you were pinning her down, she was like screaming things.  Is it also true that she bit you?  Oh, yeah, she bit me.  Okay, how's that healing up?  Wow, that's pretty incredible.  It sucks.  Yeah, yeah, absolutely.  So what happened afterward?  Did the police come and break things up?  Because you were calling for police during the video.  What exactly happened afterward?

I got to tell you, the response time was amazing.  Like, they were there within a few minutes, you know?  So they came, and I had let her up, and she was sitting against the railing of the overpass.  And then the police, well, fire showed up.  Big old fire truck showed up and everything, and they got out.  They didn't really know what to do.  There was not really a fire or anything, like, for them to deal with.  So she was sitting against the overpass, and the police pulled up, like, right behind them.  And so then she got up and went over to the police and whatever.  And then the police took my statement, which you can see me do, because I still have my live stream going.  Like, for 30 minutes.  So I take you through the whole thing.  I videotaped myself giving my statement to the police.  And then the girl that actually was involved in the altercation, she gave her statement to the police.  And then they went over and they took the professor's statement, the nutty professor.

And so this has not been like the first.  In Portland, and you probably heard in Berkeley, a lot of sort of violent interactions between sort of pro-Trump right-wing protesters and Antifa and left-wing protesters.  Is this the first time you've been at one of these events?  And what do you think of this sort of like these often violent interactions between the two groups?
I think it's stupid.
There's no reason for it.

So if you have an opposing view, I want to know why.  Why do you not like Trump so much?  Why do you hate him that much that you want to fight people over it?  And you want to call people Nazis and you want to tell them that they're the scum of the earth just because we support our president or because we have a differing view.  I want to know why.
Why?

What is it that you are so enraged about?  But nobody wants to talk.  Especially these people that are under this Antifa banner.  It's almost like a thing.  Like some kind of pact.  Like they're not supposed to talk.  They don't talk.  A couple of them at rallies I've been to have said, I'm not talking to you.  I'm not talking to you.  I can't talk to you.  I'm not going to.
I'm like, why?

Why not?  Then they won't say nothing.  And they shut off.  Almost like... Just answering that, I'm not going to talk to you, has gone too far.  It's the most bizarre thing, almost like a cult.  It's really, really weird, strange, the interactions I've had anyway.
How many times have you been to one of these protests?
Five, seven times.  Nine?
I don't know.  A few.  A little few.  A little few.  All right, and last question.  Do you think Epstein killed himself?
Epstein did not kill himself.
All right, there it is.  Tara La Rosa, thank you for coming on to The Daily Caller.  It was great talking to you.  Have a great day.
Thank you.  You too.
